properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 3:29AM EST until February 18 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations
of 3 to 7 inches.

* WHERE...Northern Oneida County.

* WHEN...Light snow begins by daybreak. The snow quickly becomes
steady and even heavy at times this morning. Periods of snow
continue into the early afternoon, before mixing with and
changing to rain showers late in the day.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and snow covered roads. The hazardous
winter weather conditions could impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southeast winds at 10 to 20 mph, with gusts
up to 30 mph will create areas of blowing and drifting snow.
Temperatures will be in the lower 20s early this morning, then
rising to near 30 degrees by midday. It should warm above
freezing and into the upper 30s by late afternoon. Snowfall
rates could exceed 1 inch per hour at times this morning.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON
